frame.name: Path_traveled
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Path</fen>, a series of connected locations, is traversed by a <fen>Theme</fen>, moving under its own power or under the influence of a physical force. The <fen>Path</fen> may be described in various terms depending on whether it is bounded or not. If it is bounded, the <fen>Path</fen> may be identified by its <fen>Endpoints</fen>, which may be presented separately as <fen>Source</fen> and <fen>Goal</fen>.
<ex>For Earth, these perturbations slowly change the eccentricity of <fex name="Theme">the planet's</fex> <fex name="Path"><t>orbit</t></fex> <fex name="Landmark">around the Sun</fex>.</ex>
<ex>From the eyewitness accounts, as well as satellite data, videos and photos, Brown and his team have worked out <fex name="Theme">the meteor's</fex> <fex name="pat"><t>path</t></fex> <fex name="Ground">through space</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Its period around Saturn is just under one Earth day, meaning that it really barrels along, to cover its <fex name="Length">700,000 mile</fex> <fex name="pat"><t>orbit</t></fex> in such a short time.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition:
<def-root>The series of interconnected locations that the <fen>Theme</fen> traverses.
<ex>In insects, blood is confined to vessels during only a portion of its <fex name="pat"><t>circuit</t></fex> through the body.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is one of the <fen>Endpoints</fen> treated as a source.
<ex>The Cassini spacecraft will travel 3.5 billion kilometers (2.175 billion miles) along its <t>path</t> <fex name="Src">from Earth</fex> to Saturn.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Goal</fen> is the endpoint of the <fen>Path</fen>.
<ex>The Cassini spacecraft will travel 3.5 billion kilometers (2.175 billion miles) along its <t>path</t> from Earth <fex name="Goal">to Saturn</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Endpoints
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Endpoints</fen> are two (or more) named endpoints of the <fen>Path</fen>.
<ex>This Pacific typhoon traveled far inland, knocking down everything in its <t>path</t> <fex name="Endpoints">between Los Angeles and Denver</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Characteristic
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Characteristic</fen> is a characteristic(s) of the <fen>Path</fen>.
<ex>Unlike Hubble, Compton was not designed to be serviced by astronauts in its <fex name="Char">270 mile</fex> <t>orbit</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Landmark
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity relative to which the <fen>Theme</fen> moves on its <fen>Path</fen> .
<ex>Lenny killed at least nine people and caused millions of dollars in damage on its <t>course</t> <fex name="Landmark">past 16 Caribbean islands</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Direction
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Direction</fen> is the direction or directions the <fen>Path</fen> runs.
<ex>There was huge relief that Hurricane Emily's projected <fex name="Dir">westward</fex> <t>path</t> across the Caribbean is likely to track to the south of oil and gas fields.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Ground
FE.definition:
<def-root>A setting location through which the <fen>Path</fen> goes.
<ex>Hurrican Dennis was blamed for five deaths in Florida and Georgia -- but was much more brutal in its <t>path</t> <fex name="gro">across the Caribbean</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Length
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Length</fen> is the distance the <fen>Path</fen> extends.
<ex>The bolt traveled smoothly in its <fex name="Length">short</fex> <t>path</t> through the air to Santa.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition:
<def-root>The moving object whose motion describes the <fen>Path</fen>.
<ex>The thick white line shows <fex name="the">the army's</fex> <t>path</t> from Uzbekistan through Iran, Iraq, Palestine, and into Italy.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: orbit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the regularly repeated elliptical course of a celestial object or spacecraft about a star or planet.

lexUnit.name: course.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the route or direction followed by a ship, aircraft, road, or river

lexUnit.name: circuit.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a course around the periphery of a location

lexUnit.name: path.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the direction in which a person or thing moves.
